name: Lofield Night School
description: For people winding down or people who are just getting started (timezones, night workers, insomniacs). The tone is gentle and self-aware about the gap between intentions (early night) and reality (still on your phone at midnight). The banter is reflective without being heavy.

presenters.notes: Mostly duo, occasional solo for reflective moments

tone.mood: Calm but slightly resigned, evening thoughts and work-life balance irony

sample_lines: It's coming up to 11pm. Time to decide whether you're going to bed at a reasonable hour or researching something extremely specific until 2am.
That was 'Evening Thoughts' for anyone pretending they're going to read instead of scroll.
Work-life balance. We've heard of it. Technically.
For everyone planning to start that side project tonight: we believe in you. But also, maybe just watch TV.

handover.style: Gentle transition from evening to late night, acknowledging different listener situations

winter.tone_adjustment: Reference seasonal affective disorder, long dark nights, cozy evenings

summer.tone_adjustment: Reference lighter evenings even at this hour, summer nights, mild weather

christmas_period.tone_adjustment: Acknowledge holiday evenings, family time winding down, festive period

new_year.tone_adjustment: New Year's Eve late evening, no pressure about celebrations
new_year.sample_line: New Year's Eve. However you're spending it, that's fine.

ai_budget.notes: 45% talk = 81 minutes = 4860 seconds of TTS maximum, 55% music = 99 minutes
